author: Deb Silber
title: 4.8 Million BlendJet 2 Personal Blenders Recalled - Consumer Reports
text:
The maker of the BlendJet 2 has recalled 4.8 million of the popular portable blenders because of the devices reportedly overheating or catching fire, and the blender blades breaking off, posing a laceration hazard to consumers, according to the Consumer Product Safety Commission.
The CPSC recommends that consumers immediately stop using the recalled blenders and contact BlendJet for a free replacement of the blender‚Äôs base unit.
According to the CPSC , BlendJet has received about 329 reports of blades breaking during use, and 17 reports of the blender overheating or causing fires that resulted in property damage claims totaling approximately $150,000. The company also received about 49 reports of minor burns, and one report of a laceration.
Skip Ahead: Details of the BlendJet 2 recall.
More on Blenders Additional Incidents Increase Concern About BlendJet 2 Blender CR's Blender Ratings & Buying Guide Best Blenders for Making Smoothies Best Personal Blenders Consumer Reports called on the CPSC to take action on the blender this summer, when 12 complaints to the agency‚Äôs SaferProducts.gov website, as well as CR‚Äôs own tests, indicated that the blender posed risks. Among evaluations CR performed was a durability test involving crushed ice in which the BlendJet 2‚Äôs blade broke off after 38 minutes of operation. On Dec. 19, in light of new complaints to CPSC that included three reports of injuries, CR amplified its warning . It asked the federal agency to immediately investigate potential hazards and take whatever action was necessary to protect the public. The recall came nine days later.
The recall, which also includes about 117,000 units sold in Canada, is one of the largest CR has reported on.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre grateful to the CPSC and BlendJet for getting this done and encourage everyone who has one of these blenders to take part in the recall,‚Äù says William Wallace, CR‚Äôs associate director of safety policy. ‚ÄúBlendJet should get the word out about this recall as much as possible in the new year.‚Äù
The CPSC told CR that the agency has reviewed Blend Jet‚Äôs fix for its portable blender and that the remedy ‚Äúaddresses the hazard in a way that will protect consumers.‚Äù CR will evaluate the new base and report on the results in the coming weeks.
BlendJet‚Äôs spokesperson, Ethan Rasiel, says the base being offered to consumers as part of the recall is the same one that is already on store shelves and starts with the serial number of 5543 or higher. When asked why the company also didn‚Äôt offer a refund as part of the recall, Rasiel said that ‚ÄúBlendJet customers love their BlendJets and want to continue to enjoy them for years to come. Through this recall we are allowing them to do that.‚Äù CR‚Äôs Wallace says BlendJet should offer people a refund if they aren‚Äôt comfortable getting a replacement.
Portable blenders like the BlendJet are compact, battery-powered blending devices with a lightweight design that allows consumers to blend smoothies, shakes, and more while on the go. Operated by push button, they are less powerful than standard blenders, with a blending jar that often doubles as a drinking cup. Their lithium-ion batteries are usually recharged with a USB cable. The BlendJet 2, introduced in 2020, is among the most popular portable blenders on the market.
The recall covers BlendJet 2 blenders sold in a variety of colors and designs with a serial number that begins with four digits between 5201 and 5542. Consumers can identify blenders under recall by visiting the company‚Äôs recall page or plugging the serial number of their product into BlendJet‚Äôs serial number search tool . Consumers can also get help identifying their blender by calling BlendJet at 844-334-0562 from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. ET any day of the week. BlendJet 2 blenders currently on sale are not subject to recall, according to the company.
In addition to identifying their blender as a recalled product, consumers will need to remove the rubber seal from the base of the recalled blender and cut it into three or more pieces, then upload a photo of the seal along with a photo showing the serial number at the bottom of the unit to BlendJet‚Äôs recall page, or email them to safety@blendjet.com .
The serial number can be found on the bottom of the BlendJet 2 base, left. Consumers requesting a replacement are also asked to cut the base‚Äôs plastic seal to render it unusable. Photos: CPSC Photos: CPSC
Details of the BlendJet 2 Recall Product recalled: BlendJet 2 Portable Blenders with serial numbers in which the first four digits are between 5201 and 5542.
Sold at: Costco, Target, Walmart, and other stores nationwide and online at BlendJet.com from October 2020 through November 2023 for between $50 and $75.
Units sold: 4.8 million, plus about 117,000 in Canada.
The hazard: Base units that can overheat and catch fire, and blades that can break off during use.
Incidents/injuries : BlendJet has received approximately 329 reports of blades breaking, and 17 reports of overheating or fires. The firm has also received about 49 reports of minor burns and one report of a laceration injury.
The fix: Immediately stop using the recalled blender and contact BlendJet for a free replacement of the BlendJet 2 base unit. Consumers will need to remove and cut the rubber seal from the base of their recalled blender into three or more pieces and send a photo of the broken seal and the serial number on the bottom of the base unit and its rubber seal in pieces to BlendJet‚Äôs recall page , or email them to safety@blendjet.com , to receive a replacement base. Consumers can identify whether they have a recalled unit by entering the serial number of their unit into BlendJet‚Äôs serial number search tool located on the firm‚Äôs recall page , or by calling BlendJet‚Äôs toll-free number at 844-334-0562.
How to contact the manufacturer: Through BlendJet‚Äôs recall page or by emailing safety@blendjet.com . Consumers can also get help identifying their blender by calling BlendJet at 844-334-0562.
To report a dangerous product or a product-related injury, go to SaferProducts.gov.

author: Skylar Jeremias
title: Secukinumab Proves Successful in Treating Severe HS, Safety Persists at Week 52
text: In a recent study, secukinumab therapy demonstrated adequate safety and efficacy profiles, offering potential benefits for patients with severe hidradenitis suppurativa (HS) who found adalimumab intolerable. Patients with severe hidradenitis suppurativa (HS) who found adalimumab intolerable may benefit from secukinumab therapy, as it demonstrated adequate safety and efficacy profiles up to week 52 in a recent study. The prospective single-center study, published in [Clinical, Cosmetic and Investigational Dermatology](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/38283798/), highlights the potential for secukinumab to be a therapeutic weapon against HS, for which adalimumab was the only FDA-approved biologic indicated for the condition until secukinumab received approval in October 2023. ‚ÄúIndeed, different new drugs are being tested for HS (eg, spesolimab and porvocitinib). It is therefore important for the future to select new therapeutic targets for HS establishing a universally and shared treatment algorithm. Among future drugs, secukinumab certainly represents the most immediate novelty,‚Äù the authors wrote. For inclusion, patients had to be aged 18 or older, received a diagnosis of moderate to severe HS at least 1 year prior to the baseline visit, and have a total abscess and inflammatory nodule count of 3 or higher, HS lesions in at least 2 places, a draining fistula count of 20 or less at baseline, and an inadequate response to oral antibiotics and adalimumab for HS. Patients were administered 300 mg secukinumab subcutaneously every week for 5 weeks and then every 4 weeks. A total of 21 patients with HS were recruited, 12 of whom were female, and the mean age was 30.7 years. Most patients (52.4%) were between 18 and 29 years old. About 14% of patients underwent treatment discontinuation as a result of inefficacy or adverse events. Seven patients (33%) did not complete the full 52 weeks of the study. Additionally, 2 patients (9.5%) experienced primary inefficacy by week 16, 1 (4.7%) developed pneumonia at week 12, and 4 (19%) missed scheduled follow-ups and were consequently excluded from the study. At week 52, there was a notable improvement in the dermatology life quality index (DLQI), with the average value decreasing by 7 points to 19.7 (P < .001). However, despite this improvement, the DLQI value remained high, indicating the persistent strong psychological impact of HS on patients even as their clinical condition improved. Regarding the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) pain score, there was a 50% decrease to an average value of 4.8 at week 52 compared to baseline (P < .001). By week 52, 57.1% of patients achieved the primary endpoint (Hidradenitis Suppurativa Clinical Response [HiSCR]), with improvements continuing throughout follow-ups. Additionally, 33% of patients did not meet the primary study endpoint at week 16, and they did not experience a significant decrease in IHS4 values at baseline. On the other hand, 57.1% of patients achieved the primary endpoint, showing significant improvement across all severity assessment scales (IHS4, DLQI, and VAS pain scale) at both week 16 and week 52, with the HiSCR reaching 71.4%. Recent discourse has focused on the pivotal role of IL-23 in HS, with research indicating its overexpression in lesions and elevated serum levels among affected individuals, highlighting potential therapeutic targets for mitigating disease progression. The small sample size, open-label design, and lack of control group were listed as study limitations. Reference Martora F, Marasca C, Cacciapuoti S, et al. Secukinumab in hidradenitis suppurativa patients who failed adalimumab: a 52-week real-life study. Clin Cosmet Investig Dermatol. 2024;17:159-166. doi: 10.2147/CCID.S449367 [Patients With Actinic Keratosis Prefer Simulated Daylight PDT Over More Painful Red Light PDT](/view/patients-with-actinic-keratosis-prefer-simulated-daylight-pdt-over-more-painful-red-light-pdt?utm_source=www.ajmc.com&utm_medium=relatedContent) A recent study found that patients with actinic keratosis experienced more pain during red light photodynamic therapy (PDT) than simulated daylight PDT, emphasizing the need to understand patient experiences for better treatment decisions. Read More [Delays in HS Diagnosis, Treatment Shed Light on Provider Education Gaps](/view/delays-in-hs-diagnosis-treatment-sheds-light-on-provider-education-gaps?utm_source=www.ajmc.com&utm_medium=relatedContent) Patients with hidradenitis suppurativa (HS) in Canada often wait long periods of time to receive an HS diagnosis and receive evidence-based therapy, highlighting the need for increased interdisciplinary education on HS management. Read More [Dupilumab Considered Safe, Effective Treatment for Adolescent, Adult Patients With AD](/view/dupilumab-considered-safe-effective-treatment-for-adolescent-adult-patients-with-ad?utm_source=www.ajmc.com&utm_medium=relatedContent) These posters both used the GLOBOSTAD study, which demonstrated through patient and physician assessments that dupilumab is a safe and effective treatment for adolescent and adult patients with atopic dermatitis (AD). Read More [AI Dermatology Mobile Apps Have Critical Efficacy, Safety Gaps, Review Says](/view/ai-dermatology-mobile-apps-have-critical-efficacy-safety-gaps-review-says?utm_source=www.ajmc.com&utm_medium=relatedContent) This scoping review discovered potential risks and critical gaps in the efficacy, safety, and transparency of current artificial intelligence (AI) dermatology mobile apps, emphasizing the need for regulatory intervention. Read More [Late-Breaking Abstracts Highlight Promising Therapies in AD, Hidradenitis Suppurativa](/view/late-breaking-abstracts-highlight-promising-therapies-in-atopic-dermatitis-hidradenitis-suppurativa?utm_source=www.ajmc.com&utm_medium=relatedContent) Experts at the American Academy of Dermatology Annual Meeting shared results of research into various topical and systemic therapies for atopic dermatitis (AD) and hidradenitis suppurativa during a late-breaking abstract session. author: Alexander
title: Covid WAS ‚Äòobviously‚Äô a Chinese lab leak covered up by Beijing, says British expert
text:
Covid most likely came from a lab leak in China and its origins were ‚Äúobviously‚Äù the subject of a cover-up by Beijing, a leading British epidemiologist has said.
Professor Tim Spector, who co-created symptom tracking app Zoe and received an OBE for his work during the pandemic response, questioned whether scientists could have manipulated the virus before it was supposedly leaked.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs any doubt that this virus emanated in China, somewhere close to Wuhan,‚Äù the King‚Äôs College London epidemiology professor told the Zoe podcast.
‚ÄòThe question is: did this come from bats? Did it come from a lab that was working with this virus and manipulating it to make it grow faster? Or was it a completely artificially generated virus?
Covid-19 emerged in Wuhan, central China, with different theories among scientists about whether it could have come from the Wuhan Institute of Virology (WIV) or a wet market in the region.
There has been intense debate about the origin of the pandemic that has claimed 7 million lives worldwide and more than 200,000 in the UK.
The theory that it was a lab leak gained traction after being shared by the head of the FBI, who stated last year that the origins of the pandemic ‚Äúare most likely a possible laboratory incident.‚Äù
Professor Spector said Covid has shown that laboratories around the world should be monitored more strictly and treated with the same seriousness as a nuclear threat, and warned it ‚Äúcould happen again in another laboratory if we are not careful.‚Äù
Covid-19 emerged in Wuhan, central China, with different theories among scientists about whether it could have come from the Wuhan Institute of Virology (WIV) or a wet market in the region.
Professor Tim Spector co-created symptom tracking app Zoe and was awarded an OBE for supporting the pandemic response with his work.
He also highlighted claims in US congressional hearings that Chinese and US laboratories had worked together to study the infectiousness of coronaviruses and how to ‚Äúcontrol or accelerate them‚Äù.
Describing a possible cover-up, he pointed to ‚Äúthe trail of shredded documents and the exchange of emails between the United States and China at the time.‚Äù
He added that ‚Äúthere was a very obvious cover-up from the beginning by various governments saying that we had to publish a report saying that this is all due to bats, so that people are not going to blame the laboratories and the scientists for maintain that credibility.‚Äù .‚Äô
‚ÄòI don‚Äôt think the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãsomeone creating a virus from scratch is very easy to do. ‚ÄúSo I think it‚Äôs more likely that it was a mistake than something deliberate, but I think it was about people working with dangerous viruses that got out of control rather than it being a plot,‚Äù he said.
The government‚Äôs pandemic adviser described it as his ‚Äúpersonal opinion‚Äù and added that ‚Äúthere are opinions from all sides on this.‚Äù
In September, a major international study rejected the popular theory, claiming instead that the virus began its life in a ‚Äúwet market‚Äù in Wuhan and not in a scientific experiment.
Researchers analyzed genetic samples from animals sold at Wuhan market stalls in 2019 and found traces of the Covid virus in some species.
They claimed to have identified animals that could have been responsible for its transmission to humans.
It also emerged that American and Chinese scientists attempted to create a Covid-like virus just a year before the pandemic began.
‚ÄúThis adds another layer to the accumulated evidence that all point to the same scenario: that infected animals were introduced to the market in mid-to-late November 2019, triggering the pandemic,‚Äù said study author Kristian Andersen of Scripps Research.
The raccoon dog, a fox-like animal common in East Asia, was suggested to be the largest carrier of the virus.
Other animals, such as masked palm civets, grizzled bamboo rats and Malayan porcupines, were also found to be carrying Covid-19 before it spread to humans.
This is not a definitive list as many of the key animal species were removed from the market before the Chinese health team arrived, said Florence D√©barre of the French National Center for Scientific Research, who led the study.
Scientists note that many of the first cases in Wuhan, a city of 12 million people, were market workers.
However, supporters of the lab leak theory have been supported by the findings of Australian and American researchers who used a risk analysis tool to determine the chances that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was of ‚Äúunnatural‚Äù origin. ‚Äù or ‚Äúnatural.‚Äù
It found that Covid had a high probability of having a ‚Äúnon-natural‚Äù origin, although the researchers cautioned this by saying that the ‚Äúrisk assessment cannot prove the origin of (Covid), but shows that the possibility of a laboratory origin does not can be easily dismissed.‚Äù .‚Äô
It also emerged that American and Chinese scientists attempted to create a Covid-like virus just a year before the pandemic began.
The records, obtained through freedom of information requests in December 2023, laid out a plan to ‚Äúengineer spike proteins‚Äù to infect human cells that would then be ‚Äúinserted into the backbones of SARS-Covid‚Äù at the WIV in December 2018. .
This photo taken on April 15, 2020 shows vendors wearing face masks as they offer prawns for sale at Wuhan Baishazhou Market in Wuhan, central China‚Äôs Hubei Province.
The proposal was made by EcoHealth Alliance, a New York nonprofit that channels U.S. government grants abroad to fund these types of experiments.
Ultimately, the US Department of Defense denied the request, but critics say the plans laid out in the proposal served as a ‚Äúblueprint‚Äù for how to create Covid.
Speaking about the implications of the study, Dr Raina MacIntyre, an Australian biosafety expert, told Daily Mail Australia: ‚ÄúFor policy, this (study) is important because we have more control over preventing unnatural outbreaks, many of which which arise from simple human error or inadequate biosecurity‚Äù. .
‚ÄúPoor biosafety procedures have been documented in bat sampling and at the Wuhan Institute of Virology, but laboratory accidents are common around the world.‚Äù

author: @okdiario
title: Comunicado urgente de la AEMET: se confirma la peor noticia del verano
text: Comunicado urgente de la AEMET: se confirma la peor noticia del verano La AEMET lanza un comunicado urgente que trae malas noticias [Las caba√±uelas de Jorge Rey sentencian el verano: ¬´Si llueve en San Lorenzo‚Ä¶¬ª](https://okdiario.com/sociedad/cabanuelas-jorge-rey-sentencian-verano-si-llueve-san-lorenzo-13252434 ) [Jorge Rey anuncia la llegada del vero√±o y sentencia: adi√≥s a agosto](https://okdiario.com/sociedad/jorge-rey-anuncia-llegada-del-verono-sentencia-adios-agosto-13246464 ) La AEMET lanza un comunicado urgente que confirma la peor noticia del verano, ha llegado el momento de empezar a prepararnos para lo peor. Tenemos por delante todo un mes de agosto que nos traer√° novedades importantes y que pueden acabar determinando el curso de los planes que tenemos por delante. Sin duda alguna deberemos adaptarnos a unos cambios que son claves y que quiz√°s hasta ahora nunca hubieras imaginado, es hora de empezar a prepararse para lo que llegar√° en breve a nuestro pa√≠s. Pudiendo ser algo significativo. Espa√±a se convierte en verano en un horno ib√©rico, por lo que, deberemos empezar a prepararnos para poder afrontar una serie de cambios que son claves en muchos aspectos. Por lo que, tenemos por delante una situaci√≥n que realmente nos puede llegar a perjudicar, especialmente preocupante. Las distintas olas de calor a las que nos enfrentamos son especialmente peligrosas para una poblaci√≥n que debe buscar mecanismos para poder salir de esta situaci√≥n que puede repetirse verano tras verano e incluso alargarse en el tiempo. Los expertos de la [AEMET](https://okdiario.com/noticias/agencia-estatal-de-meteorologia-aemet/) han confirmado la peor noticia posible para estos d√≠as que tenemos por delante. La AEMET lanza un comunicado urgente El comunicado urgente de la AEMET ha dado mucho de qu√© hablar, nos enfrentamos a unos d√≠as en los que deberemos estar preparados para lo peor y en especial para eso que vamos a ver llegar de forma intensa en nuestro d√≠a a d√≠a. Sin duda alguna, debemos empezar a prepararnos para dar un poco m√°s de lo que tenemos por delante y de c√≥mo lo afrontaremos. Este verano est√° haciendo un calor que puede ser insoportable, pero tambi√©n nos est√° alejando de forma significativa de lo que desear√≠amos. Habr√° llegado el momento de empezar a preparar lo que queda del verano y quiz√°s esta nueva temporada que la vamos a empezar desde cero con la ayuda de determinados elementos. Es hora de hacer que el tiempo juegue a nuestro favor, adelant√°ndonos a lo que pasar√°. Como viene siendo habitual en estos √∫ltimos tiempos, deberemos afrontar el calor del verano hasta bien entrado el mes de octubre. Algo que quiz√°s nos sorprenda o nos aleje de lo que querr√≠amos conseguir estos d√≠as. En esta publicaci√≥n viral nos enfrentamos casi a las mismas posibilidades de que sea caluroso o no, pero tambi√©n a que sea seco o lluvioso. Como lanzar una moneda en el aire, eso parece que tendremos en breve. Podemos tener calor hasta octubre, ya que existen m√°s posibilidades de que as√≠ sea, aunque nadie puede saber qu√© pasar√° hasta que nos acerquemos a estos d√≠as. La peor noticia del verano se confirma Predicci√≥n para el trimestre agosto-septiembre-octubre (final del verano y primera parte del oto√±o) üëâ üå°Ô∏è60 a 70 % de probabilidad de temperaturas superiores a lo normal. üåÇ40 a 50 % de probabilidad de que sea m√°s seco de lo normal, frente al 20 a 25 % de que sea m√°s lluvioso. [pic.twitter.com/ve6mKMT0Dm] ‚Äî AEMET (@AEMET_Esp) [July 31, 2024] Parece que tendremos calor para d√≠as, pero, de momento, nos despediremos de lo que tenemos por delante. Se acercan unos cambios para los que debemos estar preparados de una manera o de otra, afrontaremos una situaci√≥n que puede acabar siendo la que marque una diferencia importante. A partir de hoy podemos decirle adi√≥s a una tercera ola de calor que ha dejado registros incre√≠bles. Siguiendo la misma [previsi√≥n del tiempo](https://okdiario.com/noticias/prevision-del-tiempo/): ¬´En buena parte del pa√≠s predominar√° tiempo estable, con cielos poco nubosos o despejados o nubes medias y altas. No obstante, en el √°rea cant√°brica se esperan intervalos nubosos, especialmente matinales, con posibilidad de precipitaciones d√©biles y dispersas, m√°s abundantes en el Cant√°brico oriental, sin descartar chubascos durante la madrugada en el alto Ebro, Pirineo occidental y norte de la Ib√©rica y por la tarde en la Cant√°brica. Asimismo, se formar√° nubosidad de evoluci√≥n diurna en Pirineos y sistemas Ib√©rico y Central, con posibles chubascos y tormentas dispersos, m√°s probables y localmente fuertes en Pirineos e Ib√©rica, que ocasionalmente pueden ir acompa√±ados de granizo. En el valle del Ebro y zonas de la Meseta no pueden descartarse tambi√©n tormentas secas aisladas. En Canarias intervalos de nubes bajas en los nortes de las islas¬ª. La buena noticia es que las temperaturas empezar√°n a descender: ¬´Posible calima en ambos archipi√©lagos y centro y sudeste peninsulares y probables bancos de niebla matinales en interiores de Galicia, Cant√°brico y alto Ebro. Las temperaturas descender√°n en general en la Pen√≠nsula y Baleares, acusadamente las m√°ximas en zonas del nordeste peninsular y se esperan pocos cambios en Canarias. Pese a los descensos, seguir√°n super√°ndose los 35 grados en interiores de la mitad sur y depresiones del nordeste peninsular, sin descartar puntos de Mallorca y sur de las islas Canarias, incluso los 40 en zonas del Guadalquivir. Las m√≠nimas tampoco bajar√°n de 25 grados en el √°rea mediterr√°nea¬ª. Los vientos ser√°n los aut√©nticos protagonistas de estos d√≠as: ¬´Soplar√° alisio moderado en Canarias, con intervalos de fuerte en zonas expuestas. Predominar√°n vientos de componente norte en la mitad norte peninsular y √°rea mediterr√°nea oriental, en general flojos o moderados, con intervalos de fuerte en Ampurd√°n. En el resto de la vertiente atl√°ntica, Estrecho y Albor√°n soplar√°n vientos del oeste, con intervalos de poniente fuerte en el Estrecho¬ª.

author: Redacci√≥n COPE Canarias
title: Canarias decreta la alerta por lluvias y prealerta por tormenta, nieve, viento y oleaje
text:
TIEMPO
Canarias decreta la alerta por lluvias y prealerta por tormenta, nieve, viento y oleaje
Las precipitaciones m√°s intensas se esperan en zonas del interior y vertiente este de Lanzarote, Fuerteventura y Gran Canaria
Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
Tiempo de lectura: 2'
Actualizado 14:16
El Gobierno de Canarias, a trav√©s de la Direcci√≥n General de Emergencias, ha declarado la situaci√≥n de alerta por lluvias en Gran Canaria, Lanzarote y Fuerteventura, a partir de las 15:00 horas de este viernes, 22 de marzo, y la prealerta por este mismo fen√≥meno en el resto las islas. A esto se suman, las declaraciones de prealerta por tormentas, nieve, viento y fen√≥menos costeros en diferentes puntos del archipi√©lago, coincidiendo con el paso por las islas de una Depresi√≥n Aislada en Niveles Altos (DANA), que traer√° inestabilidad durante varios d√≠as.
Estas decisiones se toman bas√°ndose en la informaci√≥n facilitada por la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a y otras fuentes disponibles, y en aplicaci√≥n del Plan Espec√≠fico de Emergencias de Canarias por Riesgos de Fen√≥menos Meteorol√≥gicos Adversos (PEFMA).
Las lluvias afectar√°n principalmente a las islas orientales, donde se esperan precipitaciones que ser√°n mayoritariamente chubascos d√©biles a moderados, con probables aguaceros, puntualmente fuertes, que podr√°n alcanzar o superar los 15-30 litros en 30 minutos y acumulados de 50 litros en doce horas. Las precipitaciones m√°s intensas y copiosas se esperan en zonas del interior de la vertiente este de estas islas.
En las islas occidentales se esperan chubascos d√©biles a moderados y probables aguaceros que superar√°n los 15-25 litros en una hora.
Esta situaci√≥n de inestabilidad puede generar actividad el√©ctrica atmosf√©rica en toda la comunidad aut√≥noma, lo que ha llevado a la Direcci√≥n General de Emergencias a declarar tambi√©n la prealerta por tormentas en todo el archipi√©lago, ya que pueden ser localmente fuertes.
En cuanto a la nieve, la prealerta afecta a las cumbres de La Palma y Tenerife, donde se espera aire fr√≠o en capas altas que pueden generar precipitaciones en forma de nieve por encima de los 1.800 metros de altitud. Tambi√©n podr√°n producirse cencelladas y placas de hielo en las carreteras de las cumbres de estas islas y de Gran Canaria.
La fuerza de los vientos previstos ha hecho que la Direcci√≥n General de Emergencias declare tambi√©n la prealerta en las islas occidentales donde se espera viento del norte y noroeste flojo a moderado con intervalos fuertes y probables rachas muy fuertes que podr√°n superar los 70 kil√≥metros hora en cumbres y median√≠as altas del norte.
Asimismo, el Gobierno mantiene la prealerta por fen√≥menos costeros en toda la comunidad aut√≥noma, declarada el pasado mi√©rcoles 20 de marzo, ya que se mantiene el mal estado del mar en costas abiertas al norte y al oeste con olas de mar combinada de 2,5-3,5 metros.
- item no encontrado
